text.*:
This article relies too much on references to primary sources. Please improve this by adding secondary or tertiary sources. (June 2015) (Learn how and when to remove this template message)

An Automobile museum is a museum that explores the history of automotive related transportation.

  • Bold - Automobile museums owned by automobile manufacturers
  • Italics - no longer open to public access, excludes private or invitation only collections that was never intended for public access

  • Beijing Auto Museum
  • Grand Prix Museum, Macau

Japan[edit]

Toyota Automobile Museum, Nagakute, Japan
  • Hino Auto Plaza (ja) (Hino Motors), Hachiōji, Tokyo
  • Historic Car Gallery, Dachi,[1] Toki, Gifu
  • Honda Collection Hall (Honda), Motegi, Tochigi
  • Humobility World (ja) (Daihatsu), Ikeda, Osaka *pre-reservation required
  • Maehara 20th (ja), Kiryū, Gunma
  • Matsuda Collection[2]
  • Mazda Museum (ja) (Mazda), Hiroshima, Hiroshima *pre-reservation required
  • Mitsubishi Auto Gallery[3] (Mitsubishi Motors), Okazaki, Aichi *pre-reservation required
  • Motorcar Museum of Japan (ja), Komatsu, Ishikawa
  • Il Museo della Cinquecento (ja), Tsuruoka, Yamagata
  • Nissan Engine Museum (Nissan), Yokohama, Kanagawa
  • Nissan Heritage Collection[4] (Nissan), Zama, Kanagawa *pre-reservation required
  • Prince & Skyline Museum (ja), Okaya, Nagano
  • Shikoku Motor Car Museum (ja), Kōnan, Kōchi
  • Suzuki Plaza (ja) (Suzuki), Hamamatsu, Shizuoka *pre-reservation required
  • Toyota Automobile Museum (Toyota), Nagakute, Aichi
  • Toyota Commemorative Museum of Industry and Technology (Toyota), Nagoya, Aichi
  • Toyota Kuragaike Commemorative Hall (ja) (Toyota), Toyota, Aichi
  • Yamaha Communication Plaza (ja) (Yamaha Motor Company), Iwata, Shizuoka
  • Wakui Museum (ja), Kazo, Saitama

  • Vintage cars museum, Saint Petersburg
  • Retro cars museum, Vyborg
  • Retro cars museum, Zelenogorsk
  • Retro cars museum, Yekaterinburg[12]
  • UMMC auto museum, Verkhnyaya Pyshma (Yekaterinburg)

  • Brooklands Museum

Canada[edit]

United States[edit]

America On Wheels, Allentown, PA, United States
Indianapolis Motor Speedway Hall of Fame Museum, Speedway, Indiana, United States

Eastern United States[edit]

  • AACA Museum, Hershey, Pennsylvania. 90 cars on display.[25] Named as one of the 12 car museums worth a detour by MSNBC.[26]
  • America On Wheels, Allentown, Pennsylvania. 75 cars, trucks & motorcycles.[27]
  • Bruce Weiner Microcar Museum, Madison, Georgia. This museum has closed and the cars sold.[28]
  • Buffalo Transportation Pierce-Arrow Museum, Buffalo NY. Features a Frank Lloyd Wright gas station.[29]
  • Champlain Valley Transportation Museum, Plattsburg, NY. 25 cars plus model trains.[30]
  • Cole Land Transportation Museum, Bangor, ME. Anything with wheels. Open in summer only.[31]
  • Fort Lauderdale Antique Car Museum, Fort Lauderdale, FL. Features the largest collection of Packard Cars and historical memorabilia from 1900 and on. https://www.antiquecarmuseum.net/[32]
  • Frick Car & Carriage Museum, Pittsburgh, PA.[33]
  • Larz Anderson Auto Museum, Brookline, MA. Eclectic collection of cars, motorcycles and artifacts.[34]
  • Memory Lane Motorsports & Historic Auto Museum, Mooresville, NC. Specializes in motor sports.[35]
  • Miami Auto Museum at the Dezer Collection, North Miami, FL. 200 cars and other vehicles.[36]
  • Muscle Car City, Punta Gorda, FL. 200 GM muscle cars.[37] Named as one of the 12 car museums worth a detour by MSNBC.[26]
  • Newport Car Museum, Newport, Rhode Island. 50+ cars.[38]
  • Northeast Classic Car Museum, Norwich, New York. 160 cars.[39]
  • Old Spokes Auto Museum, New Smithville, PA. Small collection of mostly Hudsons.[40]
  • Owls Head Transportation Museum, Owls Head, Maine. 50 cars from 1885-1940, plus airplanes, motorcycles and other forms of transportation.[41] Named as one of the 12 car museums worth a detour by MSNBC.[26]
  • Saratoga Automobile Museum, Saratoga Springs, NY. Cars and artifacts.[42]
  • Seal Cove Auto Museum, Seal Cove, Maine. 50 cars and motorcycles from 1895-1917.[43]
  • Simeone Foundation Automotive Museum, Philadelphia, PA. 65 racing sports cars.[44] Named one of America’s best car museums by Autoweek[45] and Jalopnik.[46]
  • Tallahassee Automotive Museum, Tallahassee, FL. 130 cars plus a wide variety of other collectibles.[47]
  • Tampa Bay Automobile Museum, Pinellas Park, Florida. 58 cars.[48]
  • The William E. Swigart, Jr. Antique Automobile Museum, Huntingdon, Pennsylvania. 35 cars on display.[49]

Central United States[edit]

  • America’s Packard Museum (The Citizens Motorcar Co.), Dayton OH. 60 Packards.[50]
  • Antique Car Museum of Iowa, Coralville, IA. 90 cars.[51]
  • Auburn Cord Duesenberg Automobile Museum, Auburn, Indiana. 120 cars on display.[52] Named one of America’s greatest car museums by Autoweek.[45]
  • Barber Vintage Motorsports Museum, Birmingham, AL. 50 Lotus race cars, large motorcycle collection.[53]
  • Beller Museum, Romeoville IL. 70 cars, mostly from 1928-33. Not open to the public.[54]
  • British Transportation Museum, Dayton OH. 30 British cars. Not open in 2015 because moving locations.[55]
  • Canton Classic Car Museum, Canton, OH. 40 cars.[56]
  • City Garage Car Museum, Greeneville, TN. 40 cars.[57]
  • Classic Car Collection, Kearney, NE. 200 cars.[58]
  • Crawford Auto-Aviation Museum, Cleveland, Ohio. About 90 cars, mostly horseless carriages.[59] Named as one of the 12 car museums worth a detour by MSNBC.[26]
  • Dick's Classic Garage Car Museum, San Marcos, TX. 80 cars.[60]
  • Dream Car Museum, Evansville, Indiana. About 60 cars.[61]
  • Ford Piquette Avenue Plant, Detroit, Michigan. Birthplace of the Ford Model T and the oldest car factory building on Earth open to the general public (built 1904).[62]
  • Four States Auto Museum, Texarkana, Arkansas. About 20 vehicles including motorcycles. 217 Laurel Street, Texarkana, AR 71854. Open Saturdays from 10am - 4pm, Sundays 1pm - 4pm, Special Tours May Be Arranged - Please Call:(870) 772-2886 [63]
  • Gilmore Car Museum, Hickory Corners, Michigan. 300 vehicles.[64]
  • GM Heritage Center, Sterling Heights, Michigan. 600 GM cars. Not open to the public[65]
  • Hemken Collection, Williams IA. 50 cars. Open Wednesdays and Fridays, May–October.[66]
  • Henry Ford Museum (Ford Motor Company), Dearborn, Michigan. Cars, artifacts, historical displays.[67] Named as one of the best car museums in the country by MSNBC,[26] Autoweek[45] and Edmunds.[68]
  • Hostetler’s Hudson Auto Museum, Shipshewana IN.[69] Named as one of the most interesting car museums in the country by Popular Mechanics.[70]
  • Indianapolis Motor Speedway Museum, Speedway, Indiana.[71] Named as one of the best car museums in the country by MSNBC[26] and Autoweek.[45]
  • Kansas City Automotive Museum, Olathe, KS. 40 cars.[72]
  • Kokomo Automotive Museum, Kokomo, IN. 100 cars plus memorabilia.[73]
  • Lane Motor Museum, Nashville, Tennessee. 300 cars.[74] Named as one of the best car museums in the country by MSNBC,[26] Jalopnik,[46] and Popular Mechanics.[70]
  • National Automotive & Truck Museum, Auburn, IN. Adjacent to the better-known Auburn Cord Duesenberg Museum.[75]
  • National Corvette Museum, Bowling Green, Kentucky. 70 cars.[76] Named as one of the best car museums in the country by MSNBC[26] and Edmunds.[68]
  • National Packard Museum, Warren, OH. 40 Packards.[77]
  • Pioneer Village, Minden, NE 350 Cars Including the Oldest Buick in existence [78]
  • Pontiac-Oakland Museum & Resource Center, Pontiac, IL. Cars and memorabilia.[79]
  • R. E. Olds Transportation Museum, Lansing, MI. 60 REOs and Oldsmobiles.[80]
  • Speedway Motors Museum of American Speed, Lincoln, NE. Gearhead Nirvana.[81]
  • Stahls Automotive Foundation, Chesterfield, MI. 80 cars, mostly from the 1930s and 40s. Open Tuesdays.[82]
  • Studebaker National Museum, South Bend, Indiana. Historic Studebakers, Packards and artifacts.[83] Named one of the best car museums in the country by Edmunds[68] and Popular Mechanics.[70]
  • Tupelo Automobile Museum, Tupelo, Mississippi. 100 cars.[84]
  • Vehicle Vault Auto Gallery, Parker, CO. 50 Cars. Family Owned Collection. Open to the public.[85]
  • Volo Auto Museum, Volo, IL. 50 cars, eclectic collection.[86] Named one of the most interesting car museums in the country by Popular Mechanics.Popular Mechanics.[70]
  • Walter P. Chrysler Museum (Chrysler Group), Auburn Hills, Michigan. Not open to the public.[87] Named one of the best car museums in the country by Autoweek.[45]
  • Wheels O' Time Museum, Peoria, IL. Eclectic local historical displays.[88]
  • Wills Sainte Claire Auto Museum, Marysville, MI. 10 Wills cars. Open 2nd Sundays only.[89]
  • Wisconsin Automotive Museum, Hartford, WI. 105 cars.[90]
  • Ypsilanti Auto Heritage Museum, Ypsilanti, MI. Features Hudson, Tucker, Kaiser-Frazer and Corvair.[91]

Western United States[edit]

  • Academy of Art University Automobile Museum. Located in San Francisco, California on the campus of Academy of Art University with a Forbes estimated car value of $70 million.[92]
  • Allen Unique Autos, Grand Junction, CO. Private collection of Tammy Allen. Closed and all cars sold at 2016 Barrett-Jackson auction in Las Vegas.
  • America's Car Museum, Tacoma, Washington. 350 cars.[93]
  • The Auto Collections, Las Vegas NV. Rotating collection of 300 cars.[94]
  • Automobile Driving Museum, El Segundo, California. 130 cars.[95]
  • Blackhawk Automotive Museum, Danville CA. 50 cars.[96] Named one of America’s greatest car museums by Autoweek.[45]
  • California Automobile Museum, Sacramento, California. 150 cars.[97]
  • Cussler Museum, Arvada, CO. 100 cars, open in summer only.[98]
  • Fountainhead Antique Auto Museum, Fairbanks Alaska. 80 vehicles.[99] Named as one of the 12 car museums worth a detour by MSNBC.[26]
  • The Franklin Auto Museum, Tucson AZ. Collection of Franklin cars.[100]
  • Gateway Auto Museum, Gateway, CO. 50 cars.[101]
  • J.A. Cooley Museum, San Diego. 20 cars plus memorabilia.[102]
  • LeMay Family Collection, Tacoma, WA. 500 cars plus other vehicles and automotive artifacts.[103]
  • Marconi Automotive Museum, Tustin, CA. Private collection open to public that houses approximately 75 rare and exotic automobiles including Ferrari and Lamborghini.
  • Martin Auto Museum, Phoenix, AZ. Small private collection open to public.[104]
  • Mullin Automotive Museum, Oxnard, California. Collection of art deco French cars. Open only 10 Saturdays a year, but also open on most Tuesdays and Thursdays for semi-private tours.[105] Named as one of the best car museums in the country by MSNBC,[26] Autoweek,[45] and Jalopnik.[46]
  • Murphy Auto Museum, Oxnard, CA. 60 cars plus model trains.[106]
  • Museum of Automobiles, Morrilton, AR. 50 cars.[107]
  • National Automobile Museum, Reno, Nevada. 200 cars.[108] Named as one of the best car museums in the country by MSNBC,[26] Autoweek,[45] and Edmunds.[68]
  • The Nethercutt Collection, Sylmar CA. 250 cars.[109] Named one of America’s greatest car museums by Autoweek.[45]
  • Nostalgia Street Rods, Goldstrom's Automobile Collection, Las Vegas, NV. 75+ cars plus memorabilia
  • Penske Racing Museum, Scottsdale, Arizona. Racing cars and artifacts.[110]
  • Petersen Automotive Museum, Los Angeles, California. Large collection of cars, other vehicles and artifacts.[111] Named as one of the best car museums in the country by MSNBC,[26] Autoweek,[45] and Edmunds.[68]
  • San Diego Automotive Museum, San Diego, CA. Cars and motocycles.[112]
  • Toyota USA Automobile Museum (Toyota Motor Sales, U.S.A., Inc.), Torrance, California. Not generally open to the public.[113]
  • Western Antique Aeroplane & Automobile Museum, Hood River, Oregon. 130 cars plus large collection of antique planes.[114]
  • Woodland Auto Display, Paso Robles, California. Focus is on motor sports.[115]

Oceania[edit]

Australia[edit]

Current museums[edit]

  • Motor Museum of Western Australia[116]
  • National Automobile Museum of Tasmania[116]
  • National Motor Museum, Birdwood[116]
  • National Military Vehicle Museum
  • National Road Transport Hall of Fame[116]
  • The Australian Motorlife Museum[116]
  • Gosford Classic Car Museum
  • Qld Motorsport Museum, Ipswich. "A diverse array of Road & Race - Cars & Bikes - includes a specific speedway section"

Former museums[edit]

  • Ford Discovery Centre 1999-2012

New Zealand[edit]

  • Museum of Transport and Technology
  • Southward Car Museum
  • Bill Richardson Transport World
  • World of Wearable Art

South America[edit]

Argentina[edit]

  • Museo Juan Manuel Fangio

Brazil[edit]

  • Museu do Automóvel do Ceará
  • Museu do Automóvel de Curitiba
